page.title: 10Cameley Church Treasures
page.content:
Ancient murals still adorn the walls of Cameley Church.In the Porch are traces of a ship,dating back to Charles I's Ship Money tax.Inside the Church are the Royal Arms of Charles I James I,and Edward VI.On the north wall of the nave is a Knave possessed by the devil. Next to it is a foot,the remains of a painting of St.Christopher bearing the Infant Christ.Dash and scroll murals are on the chancel arch and the east wall of the nave,and above the arch are the Ten Commandments.The ancient arms of the de Clare family and those of the King of England,their overlord, complete a stunning and thought-provoking display
See also 'Betjeman Friend of Cameley'.
